During subtotal hysterectomy procedure , corpus amputate level isthmus endocervical canal electrocoagulated use monopolar electrocautery . The cervical stump close use vicryl 0 suture . DOC.brief_title: Urinary Sexual Functions After Subtotal Versus Total Abdominal Hysterectomy
DOC.detailed_description: All hysterectomy perform intrafascially use clamp-cut-ligate method describe ( Jones , 2003 ) ; Careful examination anesthesia . Catheterization N. 18 Foley 's catheter balloon Filled 10-ml saline . A transverse lower abdominal incision ( Pfannenstiel incision ) range 8-12 cm abdomen open layer . During subtotal hysterectomy procedure , corpus amputate level isthmus endocervical canal electrocoagulated use monopolar electrocautery . . The cervical stump close use vicryl 0 suture . During total hysterectomy procedure , urinary bladder dissect low uterine segment uterus cervix blunt sharp dissection . Blunt dissection do use finger push gently cervix rather bladder . Sharp dissection use Metzenbaum scissors perform patient previous cesarean section , upward traction bladder peritoneum uterine fundus stretch tightly pelvis , tip Metzenbaum scissors rest lightly fascia overlie cervix small bite develop tissue plane , dissect bladder anterior cervix . Revision pedicles ensure hemostasis . Intraoperative antibiotic ( 1 gm 3rd generation cephalosporin + 0.5 gm metronidazole ) . The abdomen close layer ; wound cover sterile dressing . All specimens sent pathological examination pathology Unit . Post-operative care ; After ensure complete recovery , patient transfer ward close follow vital sign every 15 minute till stable , every 2 hour 24 hour , every 8 hour till discharge . Postoperative antibiotic ( 1 gm 3rd generation cephalosporin + 0.5 gm metronidazole ) give eight hourly 24 hour stop ( Hager , 2003 ) . Postoperative analgesic ( Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug ) give eight hourly 24 hour need Intravenous fluid give 1st 8 hour postoperative fluid diet allow early ambulation deep breathing ( Horowitz Basil , 2003 ) . The urinary catheter remove 24 hour postoperatively . Upon discharge , patient advise resume work sexual intercourse 4 week . An appointment give patient see 6 month operation . Pre- post-operative evaluation The patient interview examine preoperatively 6 month postoperative . I. Urinary function evaluate surgery 6 month afterward use ; A. Subjective questionnaire detect urinary Symptoms include : 1 . Diurnal frequency micturition ( void > 6 time day ) . 2 . Nocturia ( wake night one time void ) . 3 . Urge urinary incontinence . ( urine leakage relate feeling urgency ) . 4 . Stress urinary incontinence . ( urine leakage related physical activity , cough sneeze ) . 5 . Dysuria ( stinging/burning sensation ) . 6 . Hesitancy ( difficulty initiate micturition ) . 7 . Reduction stream ( compare previous performance ) . 8 . Sensation incomplete bladder empty . 9 . Haematuria . B . Physical examination : Stress test : With bladder near full , patient ask cough vigorously watch leakage urine . Evaluate levator ani muscle function ask patient tighten `` vaginal muscle '' . C. Objective urodynamic study : urodynamic evaluation do participant study . All urodynamic study perform use ANDROMEDA M00101-2 ELLIPSE . The following test do : 1 . Filling cystometry ; follow parameter evaluate compare ; First desire void ( The point woman first experience awareness need empty bladder ) . Maximum cystometric capacity ( The point woman delay micturition longer ) . Maximum detrusor pressure reach filling phase . 2 . Uroflowmetry : Where maximum flow rate residual volume identify . Method 1 . The patient present symptomatically full bladder . She void spontaneously uroflow chair . Maximum flow rate postvoid residual urine volume obtain via transurethral catheter . 2 . The microtransducer catheter connect appropriate cable tube water pump . 3 . With patient supine position urodynamic chair , abdominal catheter place vagina . A dual microtransducer 6-French catheter fill port place bladder . The patient move sit position . 4 . After catheter appropriately place , subtraction check ask patient cough . Cough-induced pressure spike see Pves Pabd channel , true detrusor pressure channel . 5 . The urinary bladder fill normal saline room temperature fill rate 50-100 ml/min . First desire void strong desire void record . Throughout fill portion examination , patient ask perform provocative activity , cough straining . The external urethral meatus constantly observe involuntary urine loss . Sexual function : The patient interview surgery 6 month afterward sexual function evaluate use subjective questionnaire measure follow sexual variable : 1 . Libido ( desire ) : It describe perceive sexual desire week , subjective feeling state . 2 . Frequency intercourse ( week ) . 3 . Dyspareunia ( painful coitus ) . 4 . Frequency orgasm : intense pleasure follow sudden release tension build excitement . It describe ( always often ) . 5 . Sense vaginal dryness . 6 . Satisfaction sexual life ( satisfied-not satisfy ) . The patient allow resume sexual intercourse 4 week operation . Data collection include : 1 . Postoperative record operation time , intra-operative blood transfusion ( need ) , length hospital stay , pathology remove uterus . 2 . Postoperative complication include pyrexia , vault haematoma , wound haematoma , wound infection , vaginal bleeding , need blood transfusion , postoperative pain , cervical stump prolapse , vaginal vault prolapse .
DOC.criteria: 1 . An age 35 50 year . 2 . Menstruating woman . 3 . No symptomatic uterine prolapse . . 4 . Normal cervical smear . 5 . Benign lesion . 6 . Active sexual life . 7 . Functioning ovary . 1 . Known endometriosis . 2 . Overt neurological psychiatric disorder . 3 . Candidate vaginal hysterectomy . 4 . Use hormone replacement therapy . 5 . Oophorectomy .
